result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronnie Casmire Basley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronnie Casmire Basley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Ronnie Casmire Basley.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Due to court congestion, case was unable to be heard. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 02:30 pm.
Court will down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date by email.  Case scheduled for 10/27/2022 at 3:30 pm, Courthouse Room 623.

Case calendared for  a Status Conference on 7-27-2022. However, due to the Judicial rotation court ordered matte adjourned. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Parties notified of the new date  via email.  Status Conference schedule August 12, 2022 at 11:00am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Ronnie Casmire Basley not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD. Defense has not received discovery or offer. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronnie Casmire Basley not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared  for a Pretrial Conference on 5-23-2022.
Defendant in custody. State Public Defender Office need additional time to appoint counsel.   Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Six Points Apartment Complex
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Ronnie Casmire Basley in court with attorney Jason A Findling. Student Intern Alyssah Foster under the supervision of Jason A Findling.   Defendant Ronnie Casmire Basley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronnie Casmire Basley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 19 Lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
